Abstract: The integration of photoluminescent probes with data-enabled sensing technologies is revolutionizing the field of analytical chemistry. This study explores the application of multidimensional fluorescence and phosphorescence techniques in conjunction with advanced multivariate and N-way analysis methods. By leveraging these sophisticated analytical tools, researchers can extract comprehensive information from complex datasets, enhancing the sensitivity and specificity of luminescent probes. Image analysis further augments this capability, allowing for spatially resolved detection and quantification of analytes. The synergy between photoluminescent probes and data-driven approaches offers unprecedented opportunities for real-time, high-throughput sensing applications across various scientific disciplines. This paper highlights recent advancements and potential future directions in the development of these innovative sensing platforms, emphasizing their role in addressing contemporary analytical challenges.
